- wrclk: Clock signal for the write domain, used to control the write operations.

- rdreq is the control signal that tells the FIFO when to output the next data element.
- wrclk is the clock that synchronizes the write operations to the FIFO.
- wrreq is the control signal that initiates the writing of new data into the FIFO.

Output ports:
- q [15:0]: 16-bit wide output data bus for reading data out of the FIFO.
- rdempty: Status signal that indicates when the FIFO is empty on the read side.
- rdusedw [7:0]: 8-bit wide signal indicating the number of used words in the read side of the FIFO.
- wrfull: Status signal that shows when the FIFO is full on the write side.
- wrusedw [7:0]: 8-bit wide signal indicating the number of used words in the write side of the FIFO.

Explanation:
- q is the output data that is read from the FIFO when a read operation occurs.
- rdempty is a flag that goes high if there is no data left to read from the FIFO.
- rdusedw shows how many data words are currently stored and are available to be read from the FIFO.
- wrfull is an indicator that goes high when the FIFO has reached its maximum storage capacity and cannot accept more write operations.
- wrusedw indicates how many data words have been written into the FIFO and have not been read yet.
